##Data Analisys
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
head(df)
summary(df)
tail(df)

dim(df)

```

###Missing Values
```{r}
library(na.tools)
library(naniar)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyimpute)

df %>% filter_any_na() %>% count()
sum(is.na(df$RAIN))

gg_miss_var(df %>% select(RAIN, TEMP, PRES, wd, WSPM, month), facet = month)
df %>% select(RAIN, TEMP, PRES, wd, WSPM) %>% filter_any_na()

df[is.na(df$TEMP), ]
#ggplot(df, aes)
  
```


## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
